newsitem.title: USA: Eltrax changes terms of Atlantic purchase.
newsitem.headline: Eltrax changes terms of Atlantic purchase.

text.p: Eltrax Systems Inc said Monday it completed its acquisition of Atlantic Network Systems Inc, a Raleigh, N.C.-based distributor of data and voice communication products, though terms of the transaction were changed.

The transaction is expected to be treated as a pooling of interests. This accounting treatment, a change from the previously announced purchase accounting method, will enhance the earnings per share of the combined company, Eltrax said.

To qualify for that accounting treatment, the transaction was restructured. The provision for the distribution of $1 million of s-corporation retained earnings was eliminated, which increased the capital accounts of Atlantic Network, on a post-closing basis.
Also, the merger consideration was increased by 300,000 shares to 950,000 shares of Eltrax common stock, it said.
Eltrax's outside auditors are expected to complete a review of Atlantic Network's financial statements before the end of the year.

Directors of Eltrax have also voted to increase the number of seats on its board to eight. Effective November 1, Walt Lovett, a co-founder and former principal of Atlantic Network, would take up a seat on the Eltrax board.
The acquisition of Atlantic Network and a previously announced acquisition of California-based Datatech would bring Eltrax's annual revenue to about $42 million.

In an unrelated transaction, Eltrax said it closed on a $5 million revolving line of credit with State Street Bank SST.N and Trust Company of Boston. Proceeds of the loan are expected to be used for general working capital.
Finally, Eltrax said it filed with the Internal Revenue Service to change its fiscal year-end from March 31 to the end of the calendar year, effective December 31, 1996.
